channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Keep slaying the dragon inside’: Simon Armitage pens poem for World Cancer Day
item.description: Poet laureate tackles ‘daunting’ commission from Yorkshire Cancer Research to mark charity’s centenary year Cancer is a subject the poet laureate Simo...

item.title: Donald Trump backs Kristi Noem as calls mount to fire homeland security chief – live
item.description: US president says Noem is ‘doing a very good job’ amid growing criticism of administration’s immigration crackdown after two US citizens were killed B...

item.title: Top Democrats tell Trump: either fire Kristi Noem or we will impeach her

item.title: Reform byelection candidate refuses to disown claim that people born in UK not necessarily British
item.description: Matthew Goodwin, who is standing in Gorton and Denton, said UK-born people from minority ethnic backgrounds were not always British The Reform UK cand...

item.title: British Army officer dies after incident during live fire training
item.description: The 25-year-old died on Sunday after the incident at an army training site in Northumberland.

item.title: King and Queen meet Holocaust survivors at Palace
item.description: King Charles III hosted the reception to mark Holocaust Memorial Day with survivors honoured in a series of specially commissioned portraits.

item.title: 'We all know someone who was killed' - Iran protesters tell BBC of brutal crackdown
item.description: Young Iranians able tell the BBC how they saw friends and other people die as security forces crushed protests earlier this month.

item.title: Koepka 'rang Woods first' over PGA Tour return

item.title: Hadjar crashes new Red Bull in F1 testing
item.description: Newly promoted Red Bull driver Isack Hadjar crashes his car in wet conditions on the second day of Formula 1 pre-season testing.
